history.content:
Hi all!

I'm currently working on a personal programming project, and have some questions that are not sufficiently targeted to ask on StackOverflow or other online communities; after finishing my first semester here, I'd like to be able to go down a project-based path of learning and apply what we've explored theoretically in class in a more open format. I've looked into resources available here at Cal within the EECS community, but while we have many clubs that foster a supportive environment and true, deep STEM learning, I've yet to find a space for more casual mentorship or advising on extracurricular pursuits like this one (@6301 is helpful for academic pursuits and charting one's path through the majors, but I've not seen any open resources for personal development that aren't heavily formalized; Entrepreneurs@Berkeley, CalHacks, and some CS consultancies all offer much of this, but in a formalized setting).

Where might I go, or whom might I ask, whether for this project or future ones? More generally, what communities or spaces exist for curious students looking to explore their own passion projects or topics out of scope of the curriculum, especially in open, one-one-one settings? More specifically, I’m working with React Native, Redux, and Typescript, and building a desktop app with a strong focus on databases, text editing, and consumer-friendly languages—but I’m again generally interested in what spaces are available.

Many thanks, and wishing you all a wonderful holiday!
